content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-039-09-A |Item_parent=Medical assistance for procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Item_parent_short=Medical assistance in procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the main indications for gamete and embryo donation |Description=None |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=Patricia Fauque,Fabrice Guerif,Charlotte Sonigo,Geoffroy Robin,Pierre-Emmanuel Bouet,Stéphanie Huberlant,Nathalie Rives |Order=9}} '''The main indications for egg or sperm donation are:''' *Severe infertility or even medically confirmed sterility (premature ovarian failure, azoospermia, other very severe sperm damage). *Risk of transmitting a particularly serious genetic disease to the unborn child. *Risk of transmitting a particularly serious viral disease to the other member of the couple. *If intraconjugal MPA fails, in certain cases an egg or sperm donation may be offered. *Female couple and unmarried woman '''The main indications for embryo reception/double donation are:''' *Severe double infertility or double sterility for infertile couples *Risk of transmitting a particularly serious genetic disease to the unborn child. *No wish to use gamete donation AMP *Female couple and unmarried woman with severe infertility or infertility of the woman who will carry the child.

question.question: What are the main indications for embryo reception/double donation?
question.option_a: Severe infertility or double sterility for infertile couples, risk of transmitting a serious genetic disease, no wish to use gamete donation AMP, and female couple or unmarried woman with severe infertility or infertility of the woman who will carry the child.
question.option_b: General infertility, risk of transmitting any disease, preference for gamete donation AMP, and male couple with infertility issues.
question.option_c: Severe infertility or double sterility for infertile couples, desire to avoid genetic diseases, preference for gamete donation AMP, and same-sex male couple.
question.option_d: Mild infertility, risk of transmitting common genetic diseases, preference for gamete donation AMP, and heterosexual couple with infertility issues.
